HPoint

Point objects represent points on a two-dimensional coordinate grid.  The object’s coordinates are stored as public x and y data members.

Summary
HPoint
Point objects represent points on a two-dimensional coordinate grid.
Instance Variables
constructor
Creates a new Point object that corresponds to the point (x, y), or that’s copied from point.
set
Sets the Point’s x and y coordinates.
constrainTo
Ensures that the Point lies within rect.
add
Creates and returns a new Point that adds the given Point and this Point together.
subtract
Creates and returns a new Point that subtracts the given Point from this Point.
equals
Returns true if the two objects’ point exactly coincide.

Instance Variables

type’[HPoint]’
xThe X coordinate of the point
yThe Y coordinate of the point

See also

HRect

constructor

constructor: function()

Creates a new Point object that corresponds to the point (x, y), or that’s copied from point.  If no coordinate values are assigned, the Point’s location is indeterminate.

Parameter (by using a HPoint instance)

pointAnother HPoint or other compatible structure.

Parameters (by using separate numeric coordinates)

x, ySeparate coordinates

Initialization examlpes

var myPoint = new HPoint(100,200);
var mySameCoordPoint = new HPoint( myPoint );

set

set: function()

Sets the Point’s x and y coordinates.

Parameters

xThe new X coordinate of the point
yThe new Y coordinate of the point

constrainTo

constrainTo: function(_rect)

Ensures that the Point lies within rect.  If it’s already contained in the rectangle, the Point is unchanged; otherwise, it’s moved to the rect’s nearest edge.

Parameter

_rectA HRect instance to constrain to.

See also

HRect

add

add: function(_point)

Creates and returns a new Point that adds the given Point and this Point together.  The new object’s x coordinate is the sum of the operands’ x values; its y value is the sum of the operands’ y values.

Parameter (with HPoint)

_pointAn HPoint to add to.

Parameters (with coordinates)

_xAn X-coordinate to add to.
_yAn Y-coordinate to add to.

Returns

A new HPoint.

See also

subtract equals

subtract

subtract: function()

Creates and returns a new Point that subtracts the given Point from this Point.  The new object’s x coordinate is the difference between the operands’ x values; its y value is the difference between the operands’ y values.

Parameter (with HPoint)

_pointAn HPoint to subtract from.

Parameters (with coordinates)

_xAn X-coordinate to subtract from.
_yAn Y-coordinate to subtract from.

Returns

A new HPoint.

See also

add equals

equals

equals: function(_point)

Returns true if the two objects’ point exactly coincide.

Parameter

_pointA HPoint to compare to.

Returns

The result; true or false.

See also

subtract add
